page.title: 02Farming on the Pennines.
page.content: In recent years the farming in this area has experenced a decline, as several farmers have sold out to nearby farmers and moved out, resulting in fewer, but bigger farms. The land in the area is of a poor quality and the bulk of the area is used for rough grazing. Farmers have not attempted to improve the land. Such land is only suitable for sheep farming. But some but some dairy cattle are also kept which supply milk locally. The land is too steep for the use of machinery. Lower down the slopes, the farm land is fenced off and used either for dairy cattle or for pregnant ewes and new_born Spring lambs.The nature of the farming does not offer much employment to people outside the families of the owners.
